title: 112_hr6082
content:
The Act is titled "Congressional Replacement of President Obama's Energy-Restricting and Job-Limiting Offshore Drilling Plan." It defines terms like "OCS Planning Area" and "Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017)." The Act requires the implementation of the proposed oil and gas leasing program for 2012-2017. The Act mandates the implementation of the Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017) according to the specified schedule and applicable laws. Additionally, the Secretary of the Interior is required to conduct modified and additional lease sales in OCS Planning Areas as outlined in the Act. Lease Sale No. in various OCS Planning Areas from 2012 to 2014: 229 Western Gulf of Mexico (2012), 220 Mid-Atlantic (2013), 225 Eastern Gulf of Mexico (2013), 227 Central Gulf of Mexico (2013), 249 Southern California (2013), 233 Western Gulf of Mexico (2013), 244 Cook Inlet (2013), 212 Chukchi Sea (2013), 228 Southern California (2014), 230 Mid-Atlantic (2014). Lease Sale No. in various OCS Planning Areas from 2014 to 2016: Mid-Atlantic (2014, 2015), Central Gulf of Mexico (2014, 2015, 2016), Western Gulf of Mexico (2014, 2015, 2016), Beaufort Sea (2014, 2016), Chukchi Sea (2014, 2016), North Atlantic (2015), Eastern Gulf of Mexico (2015, 2016), North Aleutian Basin (2016). Lease Sale No. in various OCS Planning Areas from 2014 to 2017: Beaufort Sea (2016), Southern California (2017), Mid-Atlantic (2017), Central Gulf of Mexico (2017), South Atlantic-South Carolina (2015). Lease sales 229, 227, 233, 244, 225, 231, 238, 235, 242, 246, 226, 241, 237, 248, and 247 will be conducted according to the Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017). Lease sales 220, 212, 228, 230, 221, 245, 232, 234, 239, 217, and 243 will be conducted based on the Draft Proposed Outer Continental Shelf (OCS) Oil and Gas Leasing Program for 2010-2015. Lease sales 249 and 250 will be for lease tracts in the Southern California OCS Planning Area and Mid-Atlantic OCS Planning Area. Lease sales 249 and 250 will be for lease tracts in the Southern California OCS Planning Area and Mid-Atlantic OCS Planning Area, respectively, as determined by the Secretary in the specified year and in accordance with the provisions of this Act. SEC. 4. SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE LEASE SALE. The Secretary will offer leases for sale in the Santa Maria and Santa Barbara/Ventura Basins of the Southern California OCS Planning Area by December 31, 2013. Leases will require development and production from existing offshore infrastructure or onshore-based drilling.

SEC. 5. NATIONAL DEFENSE. SEC. 5. NATIONAL DEFENSE. This Act does not affect the Secretary of Defense's authority to designate national defense areas on the Outer Continental Shelf. No oil or gas activities under leases issued under this Act should conflict with military operations as per the Memorandum of Agreement between the Department of Defense and the Department of the Interior. The Secretary of the Interior must prepare a multisale environmental impact statement for lease sales required by this Act. The statement should identify a preferred leasing action and one alternative proposal, analyzing their environmental effects and mitigation measures. Nonleasing alternative courses of action are not required to be identified or analyzed. SEC. 7. Eastern Gulf of Mexico excluded from the Act. No impact on oil and gas leasing restrictions under the Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006. SEC. 8. Lease sales off the coasts of South Carolina and California. Secretary of the Interior to consult with the Governor and legislature of each state. Focus on areas with promising energy resources. Passed the House of Representatives on July 25, 2012.
